bboxes.raw_text:
Planning for the concert be presented March
the Capea Choir Of Prairie View University met Sunday
at Wesley Methodist Church. 1902 E. Washington.


Mesdames Eva Flowers, Bertha Solomon, Joan
Patrick Toer second rowRosa Edwards Ora Lackey
Messrs Edward Kuykenda Davis and Rev. Rollins,
Winslow.


The choir will appear Longvew School auditorium.

NEW YORK = Whitney M. Young
Jr., executive director of the
National Urban League, has been
offered post as the second
in-command in President John
sons "war on poverty" reported
a source last week.


However, Young had notyetde-
cided whether to accept the offer.
which would place him in one of
the highest positions to be held
by a Negro in the national ad-
miniStration.

URBAN LEAGUE HEAD
MAY GET TOP SPOT

NEW YORK Althea Gibson,
twice a Wimbledon and US. Ma
tional tennis champion, was
awarded a "New York Athlete
of the Century plaque recently.
Miss Gibson, the first Negro to
win the coveted tennis titles, re-
tired from tennis competition in
1860. She Is a community rela-
lions representative for Wards
Tip Top Bakers.

SCARSDALE. MY. A So
year-old Negro housewife Is one
Of the new arbiters of civil rights
in this suburban village Of big
estates, many clubs and
$2S, 0OO-a-year average family
income.


She Is Mrs. Marcus w. Moore,
wife of a dentist and mother of
a l4-year-old high school girl.
The family lives at III Saxon
Woods Road, adjacent to Saxon
Woods Golf Course and in an
area settled by Negro families
in the Civil Wharf.-The only area
where Negroes have clustered in
this nearly all-white community.


DR.. Moore is the first Negro
admitted to the Town Club, and
his wife is the first Negro ap-
pointed to an official village COM
mittee.


Mayor Ralph K. Rogers and
the village trustees named Mrs.
Moore as one of seven members
of the Scarsdale Citizens Advi-
sorry Committee on Human Re-
lations.


Mrs. Moore, a resident here
for eight years. Is a native of
Port Huron. Mich. She gradu-
ated from Arkansas State Col
lege and Is Girl Scout lead
err, a member of the Urban League
of Westchester and secretary of
the Scarsdale fair housing group.

NEGRO WOMAN
NAMED TO


EXCLUSIVE GROUP

CAIRO-Ethiopia has asked and
received an emergency airlift Of
arms Of American origin,
source reports. However, the
State Department officials said
they were not aware of any arms
sent to Ethiopia.


Ethiopia and Somalia have been
raiding a disputed border ter
ritory. Many lives have been lost.

NEW YORK Constance Baker
Motley, the NAACP attorney in
the Meredith case, became the
first Negro woman elected to the
New York State Senate.


Mrs. Motley, a Democrat, is
the second Negro woman elected
as a state senator in the United
States.


Miss Cora Brown of Detroit
was the first winning her seat
in 1858.

WON an Lawyer
Wins NY.


Senate Seat

WARREN, Ohio The home
of Negro, located in former
ly all-white neighborhood, was
damaged by fire when Molotov
cocktails were thrown through the
living room and garage windows.


The house Is owned by W.
Robert Smalls, executive direc-
tor TO the Warren Urban League.


MIR. and Mrs. Smalls, their
daughter and her l6-year-old son
escaped unhurt. They were sleep
ing when they heard the windows
shatter.


.Firemen who put out the flames
estimated damage at SIS, 900. One
gasoline-filled jar was thrown
into the living room and one into
the garage.

HOME DAMAGED BY
MOLOTOV COCKTAIL
IN OHIO

Norris Liggins, FL. was ar
rested as one of the men sus-
pected in the holdup of the Speed
way Market, 5033 S. l6 ST., Feb.
IL.


Ltggins was apprehended near
his home near 9th and E. Mar
guerite by detectives Ed Kulick
and Bill Dowdy.

M on jailed


In Store Robbery

CHERAW, sc. An eleven
member Negro family burned to
death in a fire that destroyed a
rented frame home in a rural
area eight miles south Of here
on US. 81.


The victims were Moses James
and his wife, Mary Agnes, both
IS and their nine children, aged
one to Is.

II In Far iIy
Die In Fire

Omega chapter, Alpha Kappa Alpha sorority
Day with traditional ceremonies the
Porterhouse Restaurant.


Program included Sorors Veora Johnson Vivian Min
yard Winstona Aldridge and McFraddte Martin.


Soror Irma Leos was hostess.
Two women who were chapter Mesdames Amelia
Thompson Rodgers honored the meeting


Mines Senoma Smith, Amelia Thompson, Myrtle
Rodgers Brooks baseus Alice Marriott baeus and
Louise Phillips.


Standing Mines Lottie WYATT
Minyar, Wnstona Adrdge Ozea James, grammateus,
McFradd Martini Doris Moen anibasileu and Veora Johnson,
chairman of committee.

The annual Coorama featuring modern hair styling
and techmes presented by Valley Hi #lO Affiliate Of the Arr
Cosmetoogists Sum- Feb. % the Masonic Temple
From left winners and their models Standing sss
Mrs. dea Soube Mrs. Florne Oliver second and
Mrs. Charesetta Lee, third


Models from left Mines Rosie Lee Reece Beverly Chambers
an Pearlene Chambers.

Arms AirIift


Denied BY US.

ritory. Many lives have been lost.
